title: On the necessity to reconsider the role of "action-at-a-distance" in the problem of the electro-magnetic field radiation produced by a charge moving with an acceleration along an axis
abstract: Some inadequacy in the traditional description of the phenomenon of electro-magnetic field radiation created by a point charge moving along a straight line with an acceleration is found and discussed in this paper in detail. The possibility of simultaneous coexistence of Newton instantaneous long-range interaction and Faraday-Maxwell short-rang interaction is pointed out.
